kiwi.ui
Class ScrollbackView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JList
                  kiwi.ui.ScrollbackView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, ListConsumer, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.Scrollable, java.io.Serializable
public class ScrollbackView
extends javax.swing.JList
implements ListConsumer

This class represents a visual scrollback buffer. Lines of text may be added to the buffer, which always displays the most recently-added lines. Older lines may be viewed by scrolling back to them using the scrollbar.

Once the buffer is full, the oldest lines are discarded as new lines are added.

Author:
Mark Lindner, PING Software Group
See Also:
Serialized Form

getSaveLines

public int getSaveLines()
Get the buffer size.

Returns:
The maximum number of lines that this buffer will save.
See Also:
setSaveLines(int)

addItem

public void addItem(java.lang.Object item)
Add an item to the buffer. Adds the specified item to the end of the buffer. If the buffer was full, the oldest line is discarded. If necessary, the buffer is scrolled to make the new item visible.

Specified by:
addItem in interface ListConsumer
Parameters:
item - The item to add.

addItems

public void addItems(java.util.Vector items)

setAutoScrollsOnAdd

public void setAutoScrollsOnAdd(boolean flag)
Specify whether the buffer should automatically scroll to the bottom when a new item is added.

Parameters:
flag - A flag specifying whether autoscrolling should be enabled or disabled.
